issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: All attempts at reproducing this issue failed, or not enough information was available to reproduce the issue. Reading the code produces no clues as to why this behavior would occur. If more information appears later, please reopen the issue.
resolution.name: Cannot Reproduce

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
I followed QuickStart exactly. However, my installation seemed faulty... Titanium was pointing to the wronge JRE Home, and no Android devices were listed. 

Uninstalled Titanium Studio, then Aptana Studio, then all versions of Java. Reinstalled Java, then Titanium. Still having problems. JRE Home now points to a v1.6 installation. Still no devices listed in Run Configuration. No help on a forum post.

h3. Actual Result
No Android devices

h3. Expected Result
An ability to run the Hello World app.
fields.summary: Clean Install- cannnot run Hello World (from QuickStart Guide)

comments.body:
Hello Francis!

Are you using JRE or JDK? You will need to have the JDK 1.6 and have it in your PATH. 

Which OS are you using? Which Android SDK do you have? Did you let the Ti Studio install Android SDK for you?

Best!
Customer hasn't replied to us yet.
